node.title: Where Afghanistan’s New Taliban Leaders Went to School
node.description: Darul Uloom Haqqania in Pakistan argues that the madrasa and its graduates have changed. Some worry they could be the source of new radicalism.

node.title: New COVID Variant B.1.1.529, Which May Evade Immunity, Found in These Countries
node.description: The new variant has a large number of mutations on the spike the virus uses to invade the body, prompting concern from scientists.

node.title: Chinese Communist Party Will Outlive United States: State Media Editor
node.description: The comment by Global Times editor Hu Xijin came after JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon said the investment bank would outlast China's ruling party.

node.title: How Long to Cook a Turkey on Thanksgiving: Temperature, Duration and Basting Explained
node.description: How long it will take to prepare your Thanksgiving turkey will depend on the size of your bird and whether it is cooked with stuffing.

node.title: Loyal Donald Trump Pardoned Mike Flynn, Who'd Gone Down a QAnon Rabbit Hole
node.description: In this daily series, Newsweek explores the steps that led to the January 6 Capitol Riot.

node.title: Lyft Driver Charged With Kidnapping, Raping Passenger
node.description: Omar Al Naser, 32, is accused of picking up a passenger in his vehicle and taking them to his home and assaulting them.

node.title: Record-Breaking Wolf Who Was First to Get Near Yosemite in 100 Years Found Dead
node.description: The male gray wolf had traveled from Oregon to California, covering almost 1,000 miles, since he was born in 2019.

node.title: Kyle Rittenhouse Hopes to Attend Arizona State University on Campus
node.description: ASU had previously confirmed that the 18-year-old was enrolled as a non-degree-seeking online student.

node.title: Company fined $320,000 after teen worker falls to his death at Perth construction site
node.description: A company which failed to provide a safe workplace for a teenage boy which resulted in him falling 12 metres to his death at the old Perth post office building is fined $320,000.

node.title: A Trump Investigation Enters a Critical Phase
node.description: New developments come as Cyrus Vance Jr., the prosecutor overseeing the inquiry, enters his final weeks as Manhattan district attorney.

node.title: The U.S. plans to prosecute unruly air passengers as complaints surge.
node.description: As millions of travelers make their way across the country for Thanksgiving, the federal government has ramped up its response to crimes on flights, especially by those refusing to abide by Covid protocols.

node.title: Are Banks Open on Thanksgiving Day 2021? Opening Hours for Chase, Capital One and More
node.description: As Thanksgiving is a federal holiday, most government offices and some private businesses are closed. But are banks open on the day?

node.title: Wellington's Grand Mercure MIQ facility not fit for purpose - Ombudsman
node.description: The Chief Ombudsman says some prisoners get better access to fresh air than people staying in MIQ in the Grand Mercure in Wellington.

node.title: Legendary jockey Glen Boss announces retirement
node.description: Glen Boss calls time on a decorated career which included three consecutive Melbourne Cup wins on board Makybe Diva.

node.title: Collins and Bridges: MP disputes should allow some natural justice
node.description: Analysis - In the wake of the National Party's unceremonious toppling of leader Judith Collins, former ministerial adviser Brigitte Morten argues the case for utilising natural justice in party…
